SUNDAY




It was supposed to be a smooth mission; grab some documents for a recent murder case and leave.
Even though it was a fairly simple task that one could manage alone, Dazai had insisted that the trio should work together so that Atsushi could watch them work and learn from the experience.
No one was supposed to be in the building, they had checked and analysed the schedules of the workers to avoid any type of contact.
And yet, when Dazai took a step into the office, he was attacked.
It was a long-distance attack, meaning he didn't get a chance to nullify the ability of his opponent. He could have avoided it perfectly, the attack had been imprecise, sloppy and of an amateur, yet his body was too exhausted to react fast enough.
The result of a poor sleep pattern (more like none) had caused this. Dazai could count in one hand the total hours he had slept in three weeks and it had taken a toll on his body. 
It angered him. A lot had changed since his days in the mafia. Back then sometimes he was actually required to work without any sleep (thanks, Mori) as a form of punishment to worsen his mental state, but in the agency they never let him come to work if he hadn't slept. So he had grown accustomed to some kind of tiredness again.
Dazai was sent flying across the room and bumped into the shelve, books and papers falling on top of him.
Atsushi and Kunikida quickly jumped into action and restrained their enemy, the blond rapidly realised from the mans glowing palms that he had shot his ability from his hands, so he tied them and wrapped them up with the nearest cloth he had found. When he finally got a glance at the opponent, he was taken back by how young the man looked, and yet he had still had managed to successfully land a powerful hit on the brunet.
"Dazai, get up here. I need you to help Atsushi and keep him stabilized" Kunikida called, shuffling the desk to find the files they were here for in the first place
But no answer came.
Kunikida rolled his eyes, sure it had been a solid hit, but he had seen his partner defeat whole armed squads with various bullets in his body.
"Dazai! Get up and stop acting like a damn child!" He snapped again
Instead of an answer from the brunet he heard a snicker coming from the man Atsushi had pinned on the ground.
Before Kunikida had a chance to shut him up, the man grinned and spoke
"Oh, the irony in those words"
The blond frowned in worry. That couldn't be good.
"What do you mean?" Asked the weretiger
The man let out a tired sigh "It's no fun when I tell you. But... I suggest you go check on your partner"
Atsushi shared a puzzled look with Kunikida and the blond walked towards the pile of books.
He clenched his fists when he realised there was no sign of his partner. Kunikida scanned the room when his eyes spotted movement in a dark corner. He made his way towards it, mind jumping into the worst-case scenario.
When he finally was close enough to the figure, he realised something; It was far too small to be Dazai.
When Kunikida's eyes adjusted to the darkness of the room his jaw went slack when he understood what he was seeing.
There was a kid, looking no older than... five or six wrapped around his partners' iconic cardigan. He was rocking back and forth, head lowered and legs brought tightly towards his chest, trying to make himself as small as possible.
This was defiantly not the worst-case scenario Kunikida was thinking of.
On second thought blond was actually embarrassed it took him this long to realise what was going on.
"Dazai?" He tested his theory, although he already knew he was right
The violent flinch the kid made in response backed him up.
"Shit..." Kunikida sighed, he didn't want to have to deal with an even more childish Dazai
"Kunikida? What is it?" Asked Atsushi who couldn't see a thing due to the position he was in
"Figured it out yet?" The blond could tell the man was smirking from his tone of voice
"Atsushi, Dazai has been turned into a child" He grumbled and walked towards the man on the floor
"What?" The weretiger wheezed out
"Revers it, immediately"
The man chucked dryly "I'm afraid my ability doesn't work like that, boss"
"Enlighten me" Kunikida deadpanned 
"There is a number on his left wrist. Go check it" He spoke and the blond made his way back towards the kid again "It represents the minutes, hours, or days my gift will work on him. Depending on the strength of my attack, the duration will vary"
"Dazai, show me your wrist, now" He commanded and the kid widened his eyes in fear
He extended his left arm and showed it to the blond

XIV/D

"The letter next to the number is the duration. M for minutes, H for hours and D for days"
"Dammit!" He cursed and the brunet quickly moved his arm away from him, curling again into himself
"How long...?" Asked the weretiger
"Fourteen days" Kunikida spoke, annoyance present in his tone
He was about to curse again when his mind realised something
"Wait, Dazai, stand up. I need you to nullify the man's ability"
The brunet, still shaking, followed the orders without question. He made his way towards the man on the floor, avoiding all sorts of eye contact, and placed a shaky hand on his shoulder. His ability activated but the cocky smile plastered on the enemy was making Kunikida feel uneasy.
When the blond grasped his wrist again the number was still there, it hadn't worked. Dazai also seemed to realise that as his face twisted in terror. He was about to apologise for the failure but the man spoke before him
"You could ask me before trying in vain" He shrugged
"Speak" Kunikida commanded
His mouth curved into a smile "Think of me like a snake. If I bite you and you kill me afterward, I won't be able to bite anyone else because, of course, I'm dead. But don't forget my poison is still inside your body. Even if I'm dead it will travel around your veins until... it finally kills you"
Kunikida felt the kid tense beside him. He chose to ignore it but part of him was relieved he had reacted negatively to the idea of his own death.
The man snickered when he saw the kids' reaction.
"Now, now, don't worry. My ability isn't actually poison. It won't kill you" He revealed and Dazai let out a breath of air he was holding
"So he's stuck like this for um...fourteen days?" Atsushi spoke
"Indeed, my friend. Enjoy yourselves"
Kunikida had had enough "You're done speaking. Atsushi, I'm calling the agency, keep him immobile. Dazai, sit on the chair and don't move"
As soon as the order left his mouth he watched the kid nod and sit down on the chair, eyes glued on the floor.
His mind wondered for a second. The weirdest thing out of this situation is that Dazai hadn't even said a word. He had expected the kid and his witty remarks to cause him trouble and headaches, but he had done the complete opposite. He was almost trying to make himself invisible.
Kunikida shook his head and called the agency
"Yes hello Sir. We have a problem"






***






Fukuzawa and Yosano soon arrived at the scene with other agents who escorted the man and arrested him. Kunikida had told them everything that had happened during the mission and they were now deciding the next move.
"Weren't you the one saying this could've been an easy solo mission? Now we've got a kid" Yosano teased
The blond man huffed "It was supposed to be, I planned it to be like that. I should have quintuple checked no one was in the building"
"Dazai got hit because of me. I was asking way too many questions and I distracted him, I'm sorry" Atsushi confessed, looking apologetic
"It was a simple mishap. No serious damage was done. Still, I expect you two to be way more attentive, don't let your guard down even in the simplest of missions" Fukuzawa spoke sternly
"Yes, sir. We apologise"
While they kept talking, Yosano made her way towards the kid.
He still had his cardigan wrapped around him, falling everywhere as it was way too large on him. He was looking at his lap, but he seemed to notice that someone was walking towards him and tensed immediately.
Yosano made a mental note about that
"Hello Dazai, my name is Akiko Yosano. Do you understand what happened to you? What that ability user did?" Her voice was gentle and soft, something the boy hadn't expected
He nodded
"Great. Well, I'm a colleague of yours, we work together. Can I ask you some questions?"
He nodded again
"How old are you?"
Dazai frowned a little, or at least that's what Yosano thought happened because with his bangs covering his face, so she couldn't really tell.
"...Seven" He replied, but it came out almost as a question
He looked way too small for a seven-year-old 
"Do you remember anything from when you were older?"
This time the answer came out faster
"No, Im sorry" Dazai mumbled
Yosano smiled at him even though he wasn't even looking at her
"That's alright. Now, how are you feeling? Are you dizzy, hungry, tired?"
"Im fine"
Yosano could tell he lied. Seven-year-old Dazai hadn't still mastered the art of bending the truth.
She was thankful for that.
"Okay, if that changes do tell me. Now follow me" She stood up and walked towards the rest of the agents, Dazai trailed behind her
The raven informed them of what she had recently learned and then asked the question everyone was probably thinking of:
"Well then, what are we going to do with him?"
Yosano saw from the corner of her eye that Dazai had clasped his hands together, he started scratching his wrists a little too strongly.
She made a mental note of that too.
"I can't do a lot. With Kyouka already staying with me I can barely handle it" Atsushi confessed sheepishly
"The boy can't stay with me, it would be way too much risk as I'm already a target to too many crime organisations" Fukuzawa concluded
Dazai had started shaking again. His mind was going way too fast for his own comfort. What was going to happen to him? Were they really telling the truth? Were they bad guys? Were they going to-
"Id rather not. I'm really not capable of living with a child at the moment" Yosano confirmed and all the eyes fell towards the blond, who widened his eyes in realisation
"No! I'm not keeping the suicidal maniac! There must be other options!" Kunikida hissed
The kid was unable to suppress a flinch.
Dazai's eyes were starting to water. He wanted to run. Why was he being so mean to him? Dazai didn't think he was a suicidal maniac! The kid didn't understand what was happening and the stress of it was starting to affect him. The brunet was focusing very hard on keeping his breathing under control and trying not to cry, but the bickering of the adults was so familiar to him he was failing miserably.
Yosano, who was already putting together bits and pieces of what could be wrong with the boy, grasped that he was on the verge of tears, looking terrified at the blond and his outburst.
"Kunikida, I advise you to calm do-"
He scoffed
"Of course not! Being partners with him is already enough torture, and now I have to take care of him outside of work? Please, I would rath-"
"Stop it, immediately" The doctor ordered with a firm tone, and everyone set their eyes on her
Kunikida wanted to ask her why but Yosano was quicker
"You're scaring him" She simply concluded and all the eyes fell on Dazai, who was doing his best to hold back his tears.

Shit

Kunikida hadn't even... He never meant to make Dazai cry.
Guilt creeped upon him.
The raven kneeled down next to the kid and gently spoke to him "We're sorry for upsetting you Dazai. Kunikida is normally a lot nicer, he's just had a rough day"
The brunets breathing hitched "Im sorry"
He didn't even know what he was apologising for, but he hoped it could get him out of any trouble.
"There is nothing to apologise for, Dazai. Now, would you like to go sit on the chair until you're calm?" She suggested
"Yes please" And with that said he quickly walked away from the adults.
When he was out of hearing reach, Kunikida spoke again.
"I didn't mean to-" He started but was interrupted
"I know, but you seem to be forgetting is that even though it's Dazai, it isn't the Dazai we know. His childhood wasn't the best"
Atsushi spoke, a little unsure "What... what happened to him?"
Yosano sighed "Dazai never told me a thing apart from the fact that it was bad. But from what I can tell right now it's severe physical and emotional abuse and neglect. He's underweight, there are already a significant amount of scars and burns on his body. Avoids physical contact, finches at loud sounds, voices, or movements. Way too alert for a seven-year-old. Minimal eye contact, extremely obedient without any question... and all that is only from observing him for 15 minutes, so there could be other issues I'm not aware of"
Kunikida let out a huff in defeat "Im an asshole"
Fukuzawa smiled at him sympathetically "You've made a mistake, it's not equivalent to being a bad person"
"Sir, I apologise for my unprofessional behavior. I should have seen the signs earlier. I'll stay with Dazai if that's what he wants"
Fukuzawa gave him warm smile
"Very well then, problem solved. You'll still have work but do bring Dazai with you. For the next two weeks, you'll stay off the field. Now, you have the day off. I suggest you go and buy the stuff you'll need for the boy"
Kunikida nodded and made his way towards the child, who stiffed when he saw him get closer
This wasn't going to be easy.
The blond kneeled in front of him and this time when he spoke, his tone was softer than all the times before.
"I apologise for my behaviour, Dazai. I was mean and inconsiderate. My intentions were never to harm or scare you"
The brunet blinked, face going blank
Out of all the things Dazai thought was going to happen, this... was not one of them.
No one had ever apologised to him.
Well except for these people he had just met, who were certainly weird.
"I understand if you don't accept my apologies. But I want to make it clear that not now, or never, will I do something to harm you"
Dazai blinked again
This had to be a joke. A prank of some kind. There was no way what he was saying was the truth.
Yet there was still a little hope inside of him. Hope that Kunikida wasn't lying and that he was actually being nice.
"I accept your apologies" He revealed, and it formed a little smile on the blonds face
It looked... real?
"I'm glad you do. Now I haven't had lunch and I'm starving, would you like to accompany me and eat something?"
He hoped there wouldn't be a catch, because Dazai was really hungry.
So the kid nodded and Kunikida got up
"Very well, lets go to the mall"






***






The food was amazing, Dazai had enjoyed it very much. He had been treated to the biggest bowl of udon he had ever seen. The kid had even been allowed dessert while he listened to Kunikida talk about the origin of the dishes they were eating.
He already knew all the stuff Kunikida was telling him, but Dazai was not about to test his luck so he stayed quiet.
Also, the blond talked with such passion that the kid had found it severely entertaining.
After lunch they began shopping.
First came the essentials, extra food, toiletry, medicine appropriate for kids. And then they started shopping for clothes.
"Dazai, what's your favourite colour?"
He was taken a little aback but quickly replied "Orange and... and purple"
Kunikida hummed in approval and started looking for clothes for him.
He picked up a bunch and showed them to the brunet.
"Is there anything you don't like from these clothes?" He asked
Dazai didn't know what to do.
Could he tell the truth? Nothing bad had happened yet. Maybe it was all a test to see how bad he would be and at the end they would punish him for ev-
"I won't get angry at you if you don't" He reassured the kid
"Dogs are scary" He finally whispered and Kunikida nodded as he put away the shirt.
"Noted, no dogs"
Wait... was it that simple?
He followed the adult through the isles, still confused about what had happened earlier.
"Okay Im going to get a few things I know you will like, but you can choose a toy yourself, multiple if you want" Offered Kunikida
Dazai looked around him. He was so submerged in his thoughts he hadn't realised he was in the toy aisle. And now he could choose one? This was way too much.
"I... are you... I- I can have one?" He asked, hoping he hadn't misheard it
"More than one, now go pick whatever you want, I'll be right here" Kunikida smiled at the kid
He still had felt bad for making Dazai cry, so he hoped this would help the kid warm up to him a little .
"Thank you very much" He said and he went looking for toys
5 minutes later, just as Kunikida expected, Dazai came back with only one toy in his hands. It was a penguin plushie. It was pastel purple and had a little pink bow on the top of its head.
"Can I have him, please?" Dazai whispered as he clutched the little penguin close to his chest
"Of course you can. I think penguins are extraordinary animals" Kunikida reassured the kid and he saw the slightest of smiles form on his face
"Now, do you want to help me choose more toys with you? There are so many things it must be overwhelming" The blond encouraged Dazai
The kid nodded and Kunikida felt a little more at ease.
Maybe these two weeks wouldn't be that bad after all.






***






Once they got all the shopping done and they arrived home it was already dinner time. Kunikida had set up the guest room for Dazai and he was pretty proud of how it had turned out, it looked way more lively than it did a couple of hours ago.
He organised all of Dazai's clothes and had placed his toys neatly in a bunch of boxes. Also, using his own deduction skills he had bought the kid a little night light even though he had insisted he wasn't scared of the dark.
Dinner was fairly simple as he was extremely tired and the last thing he wanted to do was cook, so he microwaved some ramen and called it a day.
As they ate in silence Kunikida realised something, Dazai was also exhausted. It was amusing watching how his partner was struggling to keep his eyes open while he ate, a little frown forming on his face whenever the ramen fell from his chopsticks.
Once the kid had finished his food Kunikida sent him to bed, wishing him goodnight.
The blond still had a couple of chores he had to do so he stayed up for a little more.
He cooked and packed up their lunch for tomorrow, did the dishes, and cleaned the living room. After an hour or so he was bout to go to his room when he heard movements coming from the brunets room.
Kunikida frowned, with how tired Dazai was at dinner, he should have been long asleep by now.
He gently knocked on the door, hearing how on the other side the kid gulped.
"Dazai? Are you okay? Can I come in?" He asked
There came no answer for a few seconds, and then a hesitant "...Okay"
When he entered the room he saw Dazai sitting on his bed, plushie on his lap. He was wearing the new set of pyjamas that were pastel blue and had little stars on them. Kunikida felt his heart melt a little at the sight, he looked adorable.
But he quickly shook the thought away when he recognised something else: He looked scared.
"Why are you up?" 
That was definitely the wrong thing to ask because Dazai flinched backwards and looked slightly more panicked than before.
"Hey, don't worry, I'm not angry at you. I'm just curious on why you are awake" Kunikida quickly clarified
Dazai's expression relaxed a little
"I couldn't sleep, I'm sorry" He explained guiltily
"It's okay, don't apologise, it isn't your fault. This whole situation must be a little scary, right?"
Dazai slowly nodded
"Hmm... let's see. What could make you sleepy" Kunikida thought for a second "The older Dazai would always fall asleep when I talked about my notebook and fishing, but I doubt you want me to bore you to sleep. Oh, would you like me to read you a story?"
Dazai's eyes gleamed in surprise

Bingo

"Yes please"
"Okay, I'll get a book you'll like. Lay back down"
Dazai obeyed and tucked himself in and Kunikida searched a book for him. He had a bunch of classics and he opted for Alice in Wonderland.
When he came back he sat on a chair next to the boys' bed and extended the book to him so he could look at the cover.
"Have you read it?"
Dazai shook his head
"It's a beautiful story, so sit back and try to relax" Kunikida smiled softly at the kid, who shyly gave him a small smile in return before breaking eye contact.
Kunikida read for almost 45 minutes when finally Dazai's breathing evened out. As silently as possible he set down the book and left to go to bed himself, leaving the boy's door half open so if there were any more troubles he would hear them.



***




MONDAY



The next morning when Dazai and Kunikida arrived at the agency they were greeted with a whole lot of attention, because, at the end of the day, 7-year-old Dazai was adorable.
"So... I work with all of you?" He asked, toying with the penguin he had brought to work
"Yes, indeed my tiny Dazai" Ranpo said and grinned at him "You know, yesterday Yosano told me you were coming, so-" He jumped from his seat, startling a little the kid, and walked towards his desk and opened one of the drawers "I made sure to buy all types of candy you could possibly want"
He placed a huge plastic back on his desk, all full of candy.
Ranpo smiled at the kid
"Candy?"
"Yes, do you want one? You can have all you like, but not too much because I know for a fact it can give you a tummy ache!"
His face scrunched up, he didn't know if he should talk or not.
"It's yours Dazai, would you like something from the bag?"
"Chocolate, please" He had started to shake a little.
The kid knew it was a trap. He knew that what came next would be a punishment for being greedy, still, he was unable to make himself stop hoping that maybe something nice would come his way.
He flinched when something was placed in his hand.
Wait... it was actually a chocolate bar? Were they really being nice to-

Don't be stupid, Dazai.

"Is it... bad?"
"No! Of course not! Tell you what, I'll eat it with you, so you aren't scared"
Ranpo snapped the chocolate and gave the bigger piece to the kid. The rest of the agency watched quietly form their desks. No one had ever seen the raven act so gentle with a kid before, he usually bickered back and forth with them.
"Okay, now we can eat it together!"
Dazai still looked unsure
"Or maybe you would want me to eat it first?" Ranpo raised his eyebrows
"Yes please. Im sorry"
He shrugged it off "No problem"
Ranpo ate the chocolate and beamed at the kid
"There you go! It's really good, although I prefer coconut and chocolate bars, those are the best"
Dazai still felt uneasy and it was written all over his face so the raven spoke again. 
"Don't worry Dazai, if you don't want to eat it, you don't have to. I won't get mad" Ranpo reassured him
The brunet shook his head. He could remember from a very faint and vague memory he really liked chocolate so he took a bite of the treat.
Ranpo was right, it was really good. And it actually was a chocolate bar.
Dazai gave the man a smile in form of gratitude
"It's great, thank you very much" He spoke softly and Ranpo smirked
"Im glad you like it, mini Dazai! Now remember if you ever want candy or anything, ask me!" He said happily as he sat down back at his desk.
Soon everyone started working and Dazai moved to the sofa with his plushie and a bag that Kunikida had packed for him.
He was fidgeting, feeling a little out of place. Was he even allowed to play? Could he get his book out? He was trying very hard to make no noise as he would dread to disturb the other especially while they worked.
He just sat there and hugged the penguin tighter, trying to make himself invisible.
Would they get mad at him?
Were they going to shout if he disturbed them?
Would they take his plushie away?
Would they hit him if-
"Do they have a name?" A voice brought him out of his thoughts, he saw Atsushi sit in front of him
Dazai shook his head
"It's okay" The white-haired boy smiled sweetly "A good name takes time to come up with!"
The kid stayed silent for a couple of seconds and then "You... you were there when I woke up. With Kunikida"
"Yes! Do you remember me before that?"
Dazai avoided his gaze "No, Im sorry"
"Oh no, it's okay! I was just curious" He smiled apologetically and quirky changed the topic "Are penguins your favourite animal?" Atsushi asked, gesturing the plushie
The brunet shook his head "No, I just really liked him because he's very soft. And purple"
"That's a pretty valid reason to get him. So what would your favourite animal be? I think mine are dolphins"
Dazai though for a bit. No one had ever asked him for his favourite animal
"Pandas. They have a docile temperament... and they're fluffy" He answered
"Yeah, they certainly look huggable"
The brunet nodded and stayed silent again. He was a little scared to talk to anyone because he felt like he was going to say the wrong thing and they were going to get mad at him, and that's the last thing he wanted.
"Dazai, what is in the bag?"
The brunet squirmed in his seat a little. Could he even have these types of stuff in a workplace? It was highly unprofessional, he shouldn't have let the bag be seen in the first place.
Stupid Dazai
"Kunikida packed me some stuff to do while he was at work. Im sorry, I can get rid of it"
Atsushi waved his hands in despair
"No no please, don't do that! It's perfectly fine! I was just wondering if you'd like to get some stuff out so you don't get bored" He smiled sheepishly
"I can?" He asked, wanting to be perfectly sure he was allowed to do it
"Of course Dazai, go ahead"
"Um" He opened his bag and shuffled the interior a little "Kunikida got me a workbook with activities. It has a lot of math and English, but it's okay, it's what I enjoy the most. Oh, and literature"
He set the workbook on the table and looked at Atsushi
"That's great! Do you have a pen umm or pencil?"
"Yes, Kunikida got me a lot of supplies"
"Well then, I'll leave you to it. Have fun Dazai!" He concluded as he stood up
"A... Atsushi?" The brunet spoke, fidgeting nervously with his fingers
"Yes, Dazai?"
"Kaiyo. I'll name him Kaiyo"
The weretiger smiled at him
"The ocean. Very fitting for a penguin"






***






When Kunikida got off of work, Dazai packed his things and politely said his goodbyes to the rest of the agency.
The walk home was very peaceful. Even though the blond had a car, he preferred walking to work because it was fairly close and the traffic in Yokohama was unbearable. He also liked walking because the route he took (the most efficient of course) made him pass through a park with trees and flowers adorning every inch of it. He had grown very fond of the park.
And Dazai seemed to like it too, as his eyes twinkled in awe at the flowers around him.
"Those are tulips, although I'm pretty sure you knew that already"
The kid nodded, still looking around him
"Do you know a lot about them?"
Dazai pursed his lips in concentration "They-they were first planted in Turkey and brought over to Europe in the 16th century. They can symbolise three things: Deep love, rebirth, or charity. The colour of the tulip also has a meaning... Um I can continue if you want"
"That was impressive Dazai. Not a lot of seven-year-olds know as much as you do" He praised and Dazai's face flushed
"Th-Th-Thank you" He stammered out "I enjoy learning... and reading. It makes me feel more aware"
Kunikida hummed in agreement
